events.message: The applicant submitted their auto loan application to purchase a new vehicle, providing basic personal and financial information.
The application was categorised under Auto Loan following review of the request and vehicle purchase details.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to guide the applicant through the subsequent stages of the auto loan process.
The initial review of the applicant’s credit history and financial documents was completed with no immediate issues detected.
Additional documents were requested, including the vehicle purchase agreement and proof of income to proceed with loan evaluation.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, ensuring that the vehicle details and financial statements were complete.
A credit check was completed, revealing a good credit score that supports the applicant’s ability to repay the auto loan.
The risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s financial stability and the vehicle’s value, returning a moderate risk level.
An auto loan offer was presented to the applicant with competitive rates and terms tailored to their financial profile.
The applicant provided positive feedback on the loan offer and confirmed willingness to proceed with the terms presented.
The application was escalated to senior management for final approval due to the loan amount exceeding standard limits.
Senior management approved the auto loan application after thorough evaluation, confirming all terms and conditions.
The loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s account in full to enable purchase of the vehicle as planned.
A follow-up call was made to the applicant to confirm satisfaction with the loan process and to answer any further questions.
The auto loan application file was officially closed after final confirmation of loan disbursement and applicant’s satisfaction.
